episode_title: 407 - The One Where Chandler Crosses a Line

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone except Joey and Chandler are there eating breakfast.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I just walked in the bathroom and saw Kathy naked! It was like torture!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know if we ever go to war and you’re captured, you’re in for a big surprise.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It just keeps getting worse and worse! Y’know? I mean it’s bad enough that I’m in love with my roommates girlfriend—which by the way, I think she knows. Because every time we’re in the room together there’s this weird like energy between us. And call me crazy, but I think she likes me too. And now I have seen her naked. I mean at least when I’ve seen her with clothes on, I could imagine her body was like covered in boles or something. But there are no boles, she’s smooth! Smooth! (leaves)
(Pause)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! Could everyone totally see up his robe?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah! Oh my God!

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is getting a phone number from a woman (Casey) as Chandler watches from the doorway.

content.speaker: Casey
content.text: Here you go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great! All right, so I’ll call you later.

content.speaker: Casey
content.text: Great! (leaves)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey-Hey-Hey! Who was that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That would be Casey. We’re going out tonight.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Goin’ out, huh? Wow! Wow! (Does a little celebration dance) So things didn’t work out with Kathy, huh? Bummer.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, things are fine with Kathy. I’m having a late dinner with her tonight, right after my early dinner with Casey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah-yeah. And the craziest thing is that I just ate a whole pizza by myself! (Laughs)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wait! You’re going out with Kathy!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Why are you getting so upset?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’m upset—for you. I mean, having sex with an endless line of beautiful women must be very unfulfilling for you. (He can’t believe he just sad that.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What is the big deal? It’s not like we’re exclusive.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, Joey, Kathy is clearly not fulfilling your emotional needs. But Casey, I mean granted I only saw the back of her head, but I got this sense that she’s-she’s smart, and funny, and gets you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got all that from the back of her head?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right look, I think it’s time for you to settle down. Y’know? Make a choice, pick a lane.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who’s Elaine?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross and Monica are sitting on the couch playing cards, and Phoebe is working on a new song.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: “ Little, tiny Tarzan, swinging on a nose hair. Swinging with the greatest of ease… ” Darn it! Now, I don’t know who to get to the next verse.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, you could just go uh, “ greatest of ease … (plays air guitar) BAH-bah-bha-bhannn.” Then go right into it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, ooh, I like that! Yeah. Wait! How do you know about ‘bah-bah-bha-bhan?’

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well umm, y’know, I used to play.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah, that’s right, the keyboards, huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, just a little in high school, but then I really got into it in college. I mean that’s-that’s when I really found my sound.
(Monica is taking a drink as Ross says that, laughs, and snorts her drink.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God! Orange juice just came out of my nose, but it was totally worth it. Oh my God, I completely forgot about your sound.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He used to lock himself in the basement for hours. No one was every allowed to hear, “The Sound.”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I wanna hear “The Sound.”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really? No. I mean, nah, I haven’t played in so long, and-and, well it’s-it’s really personal stuff, y’know?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on, play that funky music white boy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, you guys, I mean my keyboards are all the way up in—No, yeah, okay. (Runs out.)
[Cut to later that same day, Ross has retrieved his keyboard and is about to debut, “The Sound.”]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right! Bring it on, you…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Here we go. (Plays one note) Y’know, I’ve-I’ve never played my stuff for anyone before, so it’s important that-that you understand it’s about communicating very private emotions. (Plays another note) Y’know, umm, you should-you should think of umm, my work as wordless sound poems. That’s what I’m…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God! Play!

(Ross starts to play. He plays a key that has a back beat sound attached to it. Over the background music he plays the sound of a barking dog, a mooing cow, a laser beam, someone coughing, a jackhammer, a doorbell, a police siren, a ray gun, breaking dishes, and for a closer he plays the sound of a loud crash. Basically, the music sucks.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Boy, that was-that was, umm… terrific.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really, bitchin’!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow, it was so—wow!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?! I mean, really?!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I mean, you should play in public!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! Thanks, you guys. That’s uh—ohhh, I wanna, I wanna play you another piece! Umm! Uh-oh! I left my uh, helicopter sounds on another disk. I’ll be right back! Okay? (Runs to fetch them) This is so nice, I’m—I am so… (starts to break up and leaves)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God bless my dad sound proofing the basement!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I can’t believe I ever let him touch me with those fingers.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What are you guys talking about, I loved it! It was soo moving. Oh, plus it’s just, it’s so different from the stuff you usually hear.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You mean like, music?

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is watching Yasmein Bleeth running on TV, and the duck starts quacking.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I know what you’re thinkin’! Yes, yes, your breasts are just as firm and juicy.
(There’s a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Come in!

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Hey! (sees what’s on TV) Oh God, is that Baywatch ?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh yes, but uh, I just watch it for the articles.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: So is Joey around?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no, he’s not back yet, but he’ll be here any minute. So uh, come on in. Have a seat. Bow or stern?

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: I uh, don’t really have a preference. You?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I like it in the stern. (Realizes what he just said.) …of the boat. (The phone rings, and he answers it.) (on phone) Hello.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, it’s me. Listen Casey and I were on our way back and had a little car trouble.
content.parenthetical: on the other end at a pay phone

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What happened?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We broke down on the Parkway, so I have to walk back and get some transmission fluid. And hey, listen could you please tell Kathy that I’ll be there as soon as I can.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why can’t you tell her?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: ‘Cause I only have one quarter, and I think my time is about to—(he stops talking suddenly)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey! Joey!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I thought your time ran out.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Me too, but I guess I do have a couple of more—(his time runs out for real)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uhh, that was Joey. He’s running a little late, he says he’s sorry.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So I guess it’s just uh, you and me then.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Oh, okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I think it is!

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: So what did you do today?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I had an appointment to get my haircut…

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Oh, it looks great!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …and then it got canceled.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Well, I could cut it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?! You do that?

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Yeah, I do. Of course, I learned at my aunt’s dog grooming shop, but hey, what do you say?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Dog grooming huh? Okay, just don’t make my tail too poofy.
[Cut to later, Kathy is cutting Chandler’s hair.]

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: You have really great hair.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, thanks. I grow it myself. (Kathy is running her fingers through his hair, and Chandler catches himself enjoying it too much.) Y’know who also has great hair is Joey!

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Yes! Yeah! Joey has great hair! Umm, I’m basically done here. Just let me get this off your neck.
(Kathy leans in really close and Chandler mouths “Oh my God.” She moves around in front of him and kneels at his feet.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What-what ‘cha doin’?

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Checking to see if it’s even.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: ‘Kay.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Looks good.
(They lean in to kiss and are interrupted by the phone.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh the phone! The phone’s making sounds! (On phone) Hello!
content.parenthetical: jumping up to answer the phone

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey dude, it’s me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey it’s Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Listen uh, I’m really sorry, it looks like I’m gonna be stuck here for a while. I got the transmission fluid, but when I went to put it in the car, the transmission wasn’t there!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, it must’ve fallen out a few blocks back. I just figured we hit a dog.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Listen uh, could you put Kathy on, I wanna apologize.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah man. (to Kathy) Joey. (Hands her the phone.)

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Hey. (listens) Oh no it’s fine, don’t worry about it. (listens) Yeah-no, stop apologizing, it’s okay. (listens) Yeah! I’ll talk to you tomorrow. (hangs up) (to Chandler) I should uh, probably go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. Yes! Yeah.
(Kathy leaves and Chandler groans in agony. Kathy knocks on the door and Chandler opens it.)

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: I forgot my purse.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh.
(They kiss, passionately.)

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: No, I really did forget my purse.
(They kiss again.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, continued from earlier. Chandler and Kathy are still kissing, then they stop suddenly.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no-no-no, this is bad! It’s bad! This is bad!

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Horrible!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wait the uh, the kiss or the situation?

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: No-no-no, the kiss was good.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: No, but that’s bad!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooh! Yes! Okay! Here’s what we do, we-we forget it happened.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, we-we swallow our feelings. Even if it means we’re unhappy forever. Sound good?

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Can you really do that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I have to; he’s my best friend, and you’re seeing him.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Chandler, I like Joey a lot, but with you…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh-no-no-no! Don’t! Don’t! See-see, you’re getting me confused, I’m starting to urn.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: I’m sorry. If you wanna pretend that nothing happened, I can try.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I-I think we have too.

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: Okay. Bye.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bye. (Kathy leaves and Chandler wonders over to and leans up against the door.) Are you still out there?

content.speaker: Kathy
content.text: No. (Chandler opens the door and they kiss again.)

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is performing, his music hasn’t improved.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Electrifying. (He plays the sound of a ticking clock.) Emphatic time-time-time…
content.parenthetical: His voice is altered to sound like a computer.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, there’s a Starbucks about three blocks down.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s so inspired! Look at him! Look at him go!
content.parenthetical: pushing Monica back onto the couch

content.text: [cut back to Ross who finally finishes his so-called song with the same crash from before. He gets some applause, mainly ‘cause he’s done.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you guys-guys-guys…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, aren’t you up next?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no, I’m not playing tonight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t follow Ross! It’d be like those bicycle ridding chimps that followed The Beetles . No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, Ross sucks!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, the place has emptied because of him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God, he’s not even appreciated in his own time. I would give anything to not be appreciated in my own time!
(Rachel and Monica look at each other, and agree on something without saying anything.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. Umm, Phoebe, you suck too.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, Phoebe you’re… awful!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys. You suck too. (She hugs them both.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is opening the door, but Chandler has the chain on it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aww man! I can’t believe I locked myself out again! (He knocks on the door.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hang on buddy! (He goes over and unlocks the door and opens it to reveal a fully furnished apartment.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God! What happened here? Did you do all this?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I sure did.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I just thought it’d make me feel good to do something nice for my friend.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, you’re amazing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no-no-no. This is amazing. (He goes over and presses a button on a remote control that opens the entertainment center doors revealing the TV.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: A TV as if it appears from nowhere! That’s the dream! Man, how did you afford this stuff?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, y’know I’m 29. I mean who needs a savings account.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, you are the best friends anyone has ever had.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I don’t know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-no-no-no, you are! You do this, you give me the great advice, and hey listen, I was thinking about what you said yesterday about focusing on one woman, I’m gonna do that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You mean with Casey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no-no, I think I’m gonna see how things go with Kathy. She’s pretty cool.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Or Casey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no, Kathy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Could be Casey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. No, Kathy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Consider Casey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know what I think? I think somebody’s got a little crush on Casey. How ‘bout I fix you two up? What do you think?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That all the pieces of my life are falling right into place!

content.description: Central Perk, Ross has just finished playing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! You were really great! You were really, really great!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, thanks, thanks. So Monica tells me that uh, you don’t want to play anymore because me and y’know my talent. Is that true?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, kinda. Yeah. Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pheebs…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I-I can’t—I mean y’know I was trying to be really y’know okay and upbeat about it, I just—I feel so dwarfed by your musical gift. I…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: See but, Pheebs that-that is the exact opposite intent of my music. Y’know my music is-is meant to inspire, and if it bothers you this much, then I… I won’t play anymore.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no. No-no-no, don’t do that! How could I live with myself if I knew I was depriving the world of your music.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, okay.

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel and Monica are sitting on the couch and Phoebe is getting coffee as Chandler enters. Ross is also there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Chandler! Saw the new furniture. Very nice.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! Joey has the best boyfriend ever!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I kissed Kathy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you serious?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Does Joey know?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. Is there anyway, anyway you think he’ll understand this?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You obviously haven’t screwed over a lot of your friends. (They all look at her) Which we all appreciate.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No the-the sad thing is, if you had told him how you felt before you kissed her, knowing Joey, he probably just would’ve just stepped aside.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, don’t say that! Don’t say that. That’s not true. Is it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I think maybe, yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He loves you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Then why didn’t you tell me to do that?!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I said-I said something to Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! No, that’s right. And I thought it was a really good idea.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know, I remember that!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I remember you did.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: God!! (Sits down in disgust.) What am I gonna do?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, Chandler, you’re gonna have to tell him.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why?! Why do I have to tell him?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because you do.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, would it be okay if I wrote a song about this.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is watching TV as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Samboucha Margarita?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is that a real thing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, we only had samboucha, so it is now.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Listen ah, Joe, I-I need to, I need to talk to you about something.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s up?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s-it’s about Kathy. Umm, uh, I like her. I like her a lot actually.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You do?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, you’re timing couldn’t be better. She’s not my girlfriend anymore.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, she broke up with me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh uh, when?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Just now, after acting class. At first I thought she was doing some kind of scene, that’s why I let people watch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh man, I am so sorry. Are, are you okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I’ve been better. But, I’m all right. So you like her huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, but I-I uh, don’t have too.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no-no, no it’s uh, it’s okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. You know why? ‘Cause you can to me first.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I thought that would be the best thing to do.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But hey, listen just so you know, you might have you’re work cut out for you. ‘Cause when I talked to her, I kinda got the feeling that she’s into some other guy. So…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See uh, that’s-that’s actually what I wanted to talk to you about. I-I think I know who the other guy is.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s me. I’m the other guy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I mean when you were late last night, Kathy and I got to talking, and one thing to another and…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And what?! Did you sleep with her?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! No! No! I just kissed her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!! That’s even worse!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How is that worse?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know! But it’s the same!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, I’m sorry! But there’s nothing I can do, I think I’m in love with her!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who cares?! You went behind my back! I would never do that to you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re right, I have no excuses! I was totally over the line.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Over the line?! You-you’re-you’re so far past the line, that you-you can’t even see the line! The line is a dot to you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes. Yes! Right! And I feel horrible. You have to believe me!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is that why you bought all this stuff?! (Chandler makes a face like “Well, kinda.”) Well, y’know what I will not watch your TV, I will not listen to your stereo, and there’s a cinnamon raisin loaf in the new bread maker that I’m not gonna eat! You know why?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Probably because…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Because it’s all tainted with your betrayal. From now on this apartment is empty for me! And I’m not happy about you either. (The bread maker dings) Oh, and just so you know, I made that bread for you. (Joey walks into his bedroom and slams the door.)

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is playing his music. Monica, Phoebe, and Rachel are sitting on the couch.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God, he’s lost it. He’s totally lost it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, his music could not get any worse. There are rats in the basement that are hanging themselves.
(Ross finally finishes with the same crash, and gets some applause.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you, thanks. (Sits down next to the girls) Yeah, I lost it. Y’know, I’m not gonna play anymore, (to Phoebe) would you, can you finish my set?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: After that? Yeah! No, I mean if I can help.
(Phoebe gets up and goes to play, Ross goes over and sits down next to Monica and Rachel.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, like I could lose it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I played bad on purpose guys.
(Both Monica and Rachel laugh.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, so you were trying to play bad this whole time.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah—no, just that last song.
